summary: The Universal Service Administrative Company—a private corporation—administers 4 federal programs and about $8 billion a year in subsidies on behalf of the Federal Communications Commission. The programs aim to expand availability of broadband and other telecommunications services to low-income consumers, high-cost areas, schools, and rural healthcare facilities. We reviewed FCC and the corporation's efforts to set and report on its goals, budgeting practices, and more...
title: Telecommunications: Administration of Universal Service Programs Is Consistent with Selected FCC Requirements
